answerText: proton[10] Protons are an example of this kind of particle, whose namesake creation process must violate CP symmetry and occur out of thermal equilibrium according to the Sakharov conditions.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 10 | 20 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer some questions about unusual particle behavior, for 10 points each: [10] The decay of this particle has half-life of over 10 to the 36th power years in some grand unified theories. This positively charged particle is found in the nucleus alongside neutrons.
